intro: [WRONG START] Glochidion ankaratray, commonly known as the Madagascar glabrous leaf vine, is a unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, glabrous (smooth) leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in humid, forested areas. Its botanical features include small yellowish flowers and capsule fruits that release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
